intro: Beilschmiedia penangiana, commonly known as the Penang beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers followed by edible, dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
